Package biz.gabrys.lesscss.compiler2

Class NativeLessCompiler

  • java.lang.Object
    • biz.gabrys.lesscss.compiler2.NativeLessCompiler
  • public class NativeLessCompiler
extends Object

    Native Less 1.7.5 compiler written in JavaScript by Less team and modified by Adam Gabry≈õ.

    The library is based on the official Less JavaScript compiler adapted to the Rhino engine.

    The idea for this class implementation was based on the lesscss-java library by Marcel Overdijk.

    Example code: 

     // create compiler and source file
 NativeLessCompiler compiler = new NativeLessCompiler();
 String input = "/less/file.less";
 
 // compile source file
 String cssCode = compiler.execute(new NativeLessOptionsBuilder().inputFile(input).build());
 
 // compile source file with enabled CSS code compression
 Collection<Object> options = new NativeLessOptionsBuilder().inputFile(input).compress(true).build();
 String cssCompressedCode = compiler.execute(options);
    Since:
    2.0.0
    See Also:
    NativeLessOptionsBuilder

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public String execute​(Collection<?> options)
        Executes the compiler. You can use standard Less command line options with some exceptions:
        • use multiple --include-path options to declare multiple paths instead of the using separator ';' character on Windows and ':' character on Unix/Linux machines
        • does not support options:
          • allow imports from insecure HTTPS hosts (--insecure)
          • lint (-l or --lint)
          • makefile (-M or --depends)
          • no color (--no-color)
          • plugins (--plugin)
          • version (-v or --version)

        It also supports few non-standard options:

        • --encoding - an encoding used to read source files and save generated code (default: platform default encoding)
        • --file-system - a file system implementation used to fetch files (default: biz.gabrys.lesscss.compiler2.filesystem.LocalFileSystem). This option could be specified multiple times (the order matters)
        Parameters:
        options - the compiler options (cannot be null).
        Returns:
        the compiler output (depends on options it can be e.g. CSS code, logs).
        Throws:
        InitializationException - if an error occurred during compiler initialization.
        ConfigurationException - if the compiler is configured incorrectly.
        ReadFileException - if the compiler cannot read source file or any @import operation point to non-existent file.
        SyntaxException - if a syntax error occurred during source file compilation.
        CompilerException - if an other error occurred during execution.
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        NativeLessOptionsBuilder
